appName.tagline: Prove you lived today — then scroll.
altTaglines: Your real life opens your phone.
Walk. Sleep. Choose. Then the screen unlocks.
Everything you do earns screen time. Not just steps.
appName.nameRationale: An artist's proof (épreuve d'artiste) is the print the artist keeps. Not for sale. Not for display. Just evidence the work is real. Each gallery card the user marks is their own proof — proof they lived.

coreMetaphor.oneLine: Your life is a daily exhibition. You curate it with every choice. Screen time is what you trade to leave your own gallery and enter someone else's.
coreMetaphor.earning: Adding pieces to your exhibition — body pieces, mind pieces, heart pieces.
coreMetaphor.theNumber: How rich your exhibition is today.
coreMetaphor.threeRooms: body (how you moved), mind (how you created), heart (how you felt).
coreMetaphor.spending: Leaving your gallery for the screen.
coreMetaphor.tickets: Admission passes to specific digital spaces.

vocabulary.rules: One concept = one word. Never introduce a synonym. Grep the codebase quarterly.

experience.meaning: What your life produces. Both the number AND the philosophical concept. You have experience because you experienced things.

pieces.meaning: What you do each day. Gallery language. Each choice is a piece in today's exhibition.

tickets.meaning: App groups. Admission tickets — you buy admission to digital spaces. Gallery/cinema language.

spend.meaning: The exchange. Clear, honest, no euphemism. You spend experience.

todaysExhibition.meaning: The daily total. What you've curated today.

archive.meaning: History. Museum term. Your personal archive.

rooms.meaning: The three categories: body, mind, heart. Three rooms of the gallery.
rooms.body: The body in the world — how you moved. Aristotle's energeia: being at work.
rooms.mind: The mind creating — how you thought and created. Arendt's work: the capacity to create.
rooms.heart: The heart feeling — how you felt and connected. Epicurus's hedone: cultivation of genuine pleasure.

signatureScreens: StepsTrader/Views/ChoiceView.swift (Gallery grid — the soul of the product)
StepsTrader/Views/PayGateView.swift (PayGate — the threshold between real and spectacle)

creativeDirection.oneLine: A daily gallery of lived experience — paper, ink, and curator's marks — where real life earns the right to digital access.
brandPersonality: observational, not motivational — gallery wall text, not a life coach
minimal and high-contrast — paper and ink, not glossy UI
anti-gamification (no confetti, no rewards language, no streak flames)
quietly confident about boundaries (bold typography, hard strokes, decisive shapes — firm but never aggressive)
handmade accents used sparingly (marker underline, scribble cross) — these are the artist's proof marks
treats attention as sacred, not scarce — the gallery metaphor, not a budget metaphor

toneOfVoice.model: Gallery wall text. In a museum, the text next to a painting is: calm, brief, factual, trusting the viewer to have their own experience. It doesn't say 'WOW, ISN'T THIS AMAZING?' It says: 'Oil on canvas, 1889.' And you feel everything.

respectful.sounds: You chose this. Change it anytime.

dry.antiPattern: Oops! Looks like you haven't started!

economical.antiPattern: Unlock for 10 minutes at a cost of 4 experience

toneOfVoice.emptyStates: Empty states are gallery silence. Not panic. Template: '[What's absent]. [Neutral observation]. [Action]. Or not.'
toneOfVoice.shieldCopy: The firmest the voice gets. '[App] is closed. Open Proof to spend experience.' No shouting. No emojis. No lightning bolts.
toneOfVoice.guidesCopy: Poetry, not advice. Short lines. No imperatives. Observations that end with an open question.

voiceRules: One concept = one word. Experience. Pieces. Tickets. Spend. Archive. Never introduce a synonym.
No exclamation marks in UI. Ever. Notifications can have one, maximum.
Empty states are gallery silence — not panic.
The experience number is the loudest thing on screen. When in doubt, make the number bigger and everything else quieter.
Shield copy is the firmest the voice gets. Never shouting.
Guides tab copy is poetry, not advice.
English only. No localization in v1. Remove all loc() calls and RU strings.
visualMetaphors: paper + ink = the gallery wall. Daylight theme is not 'light mode' — it's the exhibition space.
yellow marker = the curator's hand. The accent marks what matters. Sparse, decisive.
scribbled cross = the artist's proof mark. 'This one happened. I was here.'
hand-drawn frames = the exhibition frames. Each card is mounted, presented. Your choices deserve framing.
sticker-style ticket cards = admission passes. Bright, graphic, stuck onto the minimal surface — like a concert ticket in a journal.

philosophicalFoundation.note: These aren't pretensions — they're the actual ideas already embedded in the product.

references.dewey: Art as Experience (1934): Art is not the object — it's the experience of the viewer. The gallery card for 'Dancing' isn't a card — it's proof that you danced.
references.debord: Society of the Spectacle (1967): Before you enter the world of representations, you must prove you lived directly. The PayGate is a threshold between the real and the spectacle.
references.benjamin: The Work of Art in Mechanical Reproduction (1935): Your lived day has an aura. Your feed does not. Hand-drawn frames and scribbled crosses signal authenticity, not polish.
references.wabiSabi: Beauty in imperfection, transience, incompleteness. The paper-and-ink design system IS wabi-sabi. The scribbled crosses ARE ichigo ichie — this day will never recur.
references.bergson: Creative Evolution (1907): Steps are clock-time (temps). Choosing 'Curiosity' or 'Embrace' is lived-time (durée). The daily selection cards acknowledge durée.
references.kundera: Unbearable Lightness of Being (1984): By making daily choices matter (they earn experience), the app gives weight to moments that would otherwise evaporate.
references.marcusAurelius: Meditations: 'When you arise in the morning, think of what a privilege it is to be alive.' This is the Guides tab energy.

hierarchy: One loud element per screen (usually the experience number or the header).
Everything else is quiet, aligned, and thin-stroked.
The experience number is the loudest thing on screen — always.
contrast: Daylight: text is near-black ink (avoid soft greys for primary content).
Night: text stays crisp; accents glow but never bloom into neon noise.
surfaces: Prefer strokes and paper-tone changes over heavy shadows.
Use shadows only for modal elevation and special screens (Login/PayGate).
motion: Use spring for selection/toggles; easeInOut for overlays/visibility.
iconography: Icons are bold/solid for primary actions, lighter/outlined for secondary.

daylight.intent: The exhibition space. Warm paper, ink strokes. Feels printed. This is not 'light mode' — it's the gallery wall.

accent.usage: The curator's hand. Use for experience numbers, tags, underline, key interactive strokes. Sparse, decisive.

night.intent: Night exhibition. Same accent, darker context. Modals can glow a bit.

minimal.intent: Monochrome, harsh minimalism. Strokes fully opaque. The purest paper-and-ink.
minimal.accentBehavior: In minimal theme, accent becomes mono (AppTheme.accentColor returns black).

system.notes: Use sparingly; Daylight is the intended editorial aesthetic — the gallery wall.

tickets.intent: Clean minimal page with strong yellow accent, sticker card titles, light shadows. Admission passes to digital spaces.
tickets.pageBackground: near-white in light, pure black in dark (ShieldsPalette.pageBackground)

payGate.intent: The threshold between the real and the spectacle. Black stage, yellow accent, high-contrast CTA buttons, glow behind icon.

loginOnboarding.intent: Dark gradient with soft colored fog circles; glossy hero badge; crisp typography. Gallery-concept-first.

rules: Horizontal carousels: inter-item spacing 8, with 16 edge padding.
Small chips and icon tiles: 8–14 radius.
Use capsules for experience pills and primary 'Create' buttons in special palettes.
Daylight separation is a stroke, not a shadow.
Prefer a single stroke overlay over multiple nested shadows.

use: secondary surfaces that should feel 'system glass' rather than paper

body.name: System (Font.notoSerif wrapper)
body.usage: Most UI. Crisp, factual. Uses monospacedDigit for numeric emphasis.

handwrittenHeader.name: Reenie Beanie (Font.reenie)
handwrittenHeader.usage: Top-of-screen editorial headers ('today', 'my experience', 'my body', 'my mind', 'my heart').

stickerTitle.usage: Ticket card title only. Loud, graphic, sticker energy — like a concert ticket in a journal.

experienceBigNumber.note: The loudest element on screen. The experience number. When in doubt, make it bigger.

numericStyle.rule: All experience numbers, costs, timers use .monospacedDigit().

brandAccent.name: brandYellowMarker (code: AppColors.brandPink)
brandAccent.notes: The curator's hand. Treat as highlighter/marker. Never flood entire screens in Daylight.

ticketsAccent.notes: More saturated/cleaner yellow used in ticket and paygate palettes.

semantic.success: green (tiny dot only, not full buttons)

navigation.titles: Often hidden or inline; screen uses its own large header (handwritten) instead of big navigation titles.

tabs.name: Gallery
tabs.content: Daily exhibition — three rooms of pieces (body, mind, heart)

tabs.name: Guides
tabs.content: Philosophy wall texts — 5–7 short entries like gallery wall text

tabBar.iconStyle: SF Symbols, minimal. Avoid decorative icons.
tabBar.selection: Keep content padding so bottom fixed buttons do not clash with tab bar.

gridsAndLists.paperMode: Use VStack + thin separators; avoid heavy cards.
gridsAndLists.ticketsMode: Stacked list with slight rotation offsets and sticker header.
gridsAndLists.forms: Use List(.insetGrouped) for editors (category edit, custom activity).

selection.use: gallery piece selection, chips, small state changes

use: light impact for expanding a ticket
haptics.rule: Haptics only for meaningful state changes; never for passive scrolling.

buttonBehavior.primaryCTA: Use ScaleButtonStyle for PayGate unlock buttons.
buttonBehavior.secondary: Plain buttonStyle, rely on typography + stroke.

divider.name: ThemedDivider
divider.appearance: 1pt rectangle using theme stroke opacity; not iOS gray divider.

underline.name: YellowMarkerUnderline
underline.implementation: SwiftUI component: PinkUnderline (uses theme accent color, which is yellow)
underline.appearance: slightly imperfect quadratic curve stroke, 2pt (marker-on-paper vibe — the curator's hand)

emptyState.name: EmptyStateView
emptyState.tone: Gallery silence. Never panic. Template: '[What's absent]. [Neutral observation]. [Action]. Or not.'
examples: No pieces chosen today. The gallery is quiet.
Your archive is empty. It starts tomorrow.

textButton.appearance: plain, small caption/12pt system, secondary color

payGateUnlock.fill: accent yellow when enabled; dark surface when disabled
payGateUnlock.text: black when enabled; white@0.6 when disabled
payGateUnlock.label: spend experience

payGateClose.label: keep it closed
payGateClose.note: Not 'keep it locked' — 'locked' implies punishment; 'closed' implies choice.

paperCard.intent: Paper sections that feel printed; low/no shadow. The gallery wall.

glassCard.intent: System-glass look for status rows and ticket rows.

modalCard.intent: Elevated settings surface above dim background.

experienceCard.name: ExperienceCard (was: StepBalanceCard)
experienceCard.intent: The hero element — shows today's total experience and the three rooms.

bigNumber.note: The loudest element on any screen.

roomChips.note: Not 'Move/Reboot/Joy'. Not 'activity/rest/joys'. Always: body · mind · heart.

galleryCard.name: GalleryCard
galleryCard.intent: Each card is a piece in today's exhibition. Mounted, framed. The artist's proof mark when completed.
galleryCard.layout: Large painting-style card. Image area on top, caption below; padding (h:5, v:6). Inter-card spacing 12.
galleryCard.captionStyle: Action phrases, not nouns. 'dancing it out' not 'Dance'. 'following my curiosity' not 'Curiosity'.

selected.overlay: solid yellow fill (fully opaque, cornerRadius 8) covering image area + scribble cross in dark ink (black@0.25)

completionMark.meaning: The artist's proof mark. 'This one happened. I was here.' Not a checkmark. Not a gold star. Just a hand-drawn line that says: this one counts.

handDrawnFrames.meaning: Exhibition frames. Each card is mounted, presented. Your choices deserve framing.

galleryTabs.intent: Three rooms of the gallery. Each room header is two words.
galleryTabs.note: Not 'My activities / My creativity / My joys'. Always: my body / my mind / my heart.

body.philosophicalLineage: Aristotle's energeia — being at work in the world.
body.covers: The body in the world: moving, testing limits, taking risks.

mind.philosophicalLineage: Hannah Arendt's work — the capacity to create something that outlasts the moment.

heart.philosophicalLineage: Epicurus's hedone — cultivation of genuine pleasure as essential to life.

experienceBar.intent: Hard-outlined progress bar with yellow fill + yellow-outline spent segment.
experienceBar.fillSegment: yellow filled with sharp right edge
experienceBar.spentSegment: yellow stroke 2 with sharp left edge

experiencePills.current: yellow filled circle with black number

infoOverlay.intent: Small explanatory card over dim background.
infoOverlay.card: systemBackground fill + shadow black@0.12 radius 10 y 6
infoOverlay.dismiss: tap dim background or close button

weeklyReflection.intent: The mirror. Shows the trade-off honestly. Gallery wall text voice.
weeklyReflection.tone: Factual. No judgment. Just the numbers and the observation.

lockScreenWidget.intent: Show today's experience. Biggest retention driver available in iOS.
lockScreenWidget.display: Experience number, prominent. Minimal supporting text.

guidesTab.intent: The philosophy lives here. Short, beautiful texts — like gallery wall text. Not self-help. Not motivation. Observation.

entryFormat.style: Short lines. No imperatives. Observations that end with an open question.

plannedEntries.title: on proof
plannedEntries.theme: What it means to prove you were alive today. (Benjamin + printmaking)

plannedEntries.title: on the three rooms
plannedEntries.theme: body, mind, heart: a complete life in three rooms. (Aristotle + Arendt + Epicurus)

plannedEntries.title: on the spectacle
plannedEntries.theme: Why scrolling feels like doing something but isn't. (Debord)

plannedEntries.title: on imperfection
plannedEntries.theme: Why the scribbled cross is more beautiful than a checkmark. (Wabi-sabi)

plannedEntries.title: on the threshold
plannedEntries.theme: What happens at the PayGate. The moment you decide. (Debord + Bergson)

shieldScreen.intent: A closed gallery door, not a prison gate. Firm but not angry.

copy.note: No lightning bolt. No 'BLOCKED' in caps. No emojis. The shield is firm but quiet.

payGateScreen.intent: The threshold between the real and the spectacle. The moment you decide.

copy.note: Not 'keep it locked'. 'Closed' implies choice. 'Locked' implies punishment.

onboarding.intent: Gallery-concept-first. 7 slides, not 13. Start with the idea, end with permissions.

slides.copy: Your life is an exhibition. Every day, you decide what goes in.
How many steps make a good day? [slider] This is your baseline. Not a minimum.
How much sleep? [slider] Rest is part of the exhibition.
Choose up to 4 ways your body lived today.
Choose up to 4 ways your mind was alive.
Choose up to 4 things your heart felt.
Almost ready. We need a few permissions to make this work. [HealthKit] [FamilyControls] [Notifications]

onboarding.style: loginOnboarding palette. Dark gradient, crisp typography, gallery-concept language.

restDayOverride.intent: Some days you can't walk. Grace without guilt.
restDayOverride.copy: Some days the exhibition is quiet.
restDayOverride.note: Grants base experience with no steps requirement.

do: Use strokes and paper tones to separate content; reserve shadows for modals.
Make numbers monospaced; treat the experience number as the hero datum.
Keep copy neutral, observational, gallery-wall-text tone.
Keep headers handwritten (Reenie) and everything else crisp system type.
Use the yellow accent as the curator's marker/highlighter, not a wall of color.
Use unified vocabulary: experience, pieces, tickets, spend, archive, rooms (body/mind/heart).
Write empty states as gallery silence: calm, inviting, explicitly non-judgmental.
Use action phrases for pieces: 'dancing it out', not 'Dance'.
Label the three rooms consistently: body · mind · heart.
dont: Do not add gamified celebration UI (confetti, streak flames, trophies).
Do not introduce low-contrast grey-on-grey in Daylight for primary content.
Do not mix multiple loud decorative effects on one screen.
Do not add heavy neumorphic or glassy cards in Daylight mode.
Do not use exclamation marks in UI copy. Ever.
Do not use motivational language ('Great job!', 'Keep going!', 'You crushed it!').
Do not use 'Move / Reboot / Joy' — use 'body / mind / heart'.
Do not use lightning bolt emojis or aggressive iconography in shield/block screens.

aiImplementationNotes.goal: When adding new screens, choose one visual system and stay consistent across the entire screen. Use the unified vocabulary everywhere.
aiImplementationNotes.vocabularyCheck: Before writing any user-facing string, consult the vocabulary section. One concept = one word.

screenModeDecision.paperInk: Most core app screens (gallery, experience card, me/archive, guides, settings).

defaultRecipeForNewPaperScreen: ZStack background = theme.backgroundColor (daylight paper — the gallery wall).
Sections separated by ThemedDivider or thin strokes.
Buttons are plain; use accent for tags/underline and experience numbers only.
Copy is gallery wall text: observational, brief, no exclamation marks.
defaultRecipeForNewTicketScreen: Accent #FDD344 used for CTAs, highlights, and icon tiles.
Surfaces are white/near-black with subtle stroke and occasional soft shadow.
Sticker title fonts are allowed only in header-like sticker elements.
copyGuidelines: Voice: gallery wall text. Observational. Brief. Trusting. Dry where appropriate.
Empty states: '[What's absent]. [Neutral observation]. [Action]. Or not.'
Shield: '[app] is closed. Open Proof to spend experience.'
PayGate: 'spend experience' / '10 min · 4 experience' / 'keep it closed'
No exclamation marks. No motivational language. No punishment language.
English only. No localization in v1.
